snippet: The decision by the International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia prompted a wave of outrage across the Balkans.
abstract: Serbian nationalist Vojislav Seselj is acquitted by International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia of war crimes; court rules Seselj's actions were primarily political and did not abet crimes committed during Balkan Wars of 1990s; prosecutors and victims' families are outraged and warn decision could have dire effects.

byline.contributor: Joseph Orovic contributed reporting from Zadar, Croatia.

lead_paragraph: The decision by the International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia prompted a wave of outrage across the Balkans.

headline.main: Vojislav Seselj, Serbian Nationalist, Is Acquitted of War Crimes by Hague Tribunal
headline.print_headline: Tribunal Acquits Serbian Nationalist of War Crimes

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia
